meanings.definition: A person who makes a solemn promise or commitment.
meanings.sent1: The pledgeors at the ceremony promised to always be honest.
meanings.sent2: The school captain is a pledgeors who takes their responsibilities seriously.
meanings.sent3: The pledgeors joked that they would never eat ice cream again.
meanings.sent4: She was a pledgeors of love, always keeping her promises.
meanings.sent5: The pledgeors stood tall, their commitment unwavering.

meanings.definition: The act of making a formal promise or agreement.
meanings.sent1: The pledgeors of allegiance is recited every morning.
meanings.sent2: The business deal was sealed with a pledgeors of confidentiality.
meanings.sent3: The pledgeors of friendship was written on a colorful card.
meanings.sent4: Their handshake was a pledgeors of mutual respect.
meanings.sent5: The treaty was a pledgeors of peace between the two nations.

meanings.definition: To commit oneself to a particular course of action.
meanings.sent1: She pledgeors to always help those in need.
meanings.sent2: They pledgeors to work hard and achieve their goals.
meanings.sent3: He pledgeors to never skip leg day at the gym.
meanings.sent4: The team pledgeors to give their best performance in the game.
meanings.sent5: The explorer pledgeors to discover new lands and cultures.
